metadata.title: CVE-2023-52502 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:nfc: fix races in nfc_llcp_sock_get() and nfc_llcp_sock_get_sn() Sili Luoreported a race in nfc_llcp_sock_get(), leading to UAF. Getting a referenceon the socket found in a lookup while holding a lock should happen beforereleasing the lock. nfc_llcp_sock_get_sn() has a similar problem. Finallynfc_llcp_recv_snl() needs to make sure the socket found bynfc_llcp_sock_from_sn() does not disappear.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52502` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-231-generic - 4.15.0-231.243
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-231-generic - 4.15.0-231.243
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-231-lowlatency - 4.15.0-231.243
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1158-kvm - 4.15.0-1158.163
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1175-aws - 4.15.0-1175.188
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1183-azure - 4.15.0-1183.198
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1168-gcp - 4.15.0-1168.185
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1137-oracle - 4.15.0-1137.148
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-231.243').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.4.0-171.189~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1158.163').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1175.188').
